de.javasoft.swing.jytable.filter
Class FilterRowController

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.beans.AbstractBean
      de.javasoft.swing.jytable.filter.FilterRowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.jdesktop.swingx.plaf.UIDependent
public class FilterRowController
extends org.jdesktop.beans.AbstractBean
implements org.jdesktop.swingx.plaf.UIDependent

Manages per-column filters and is responsible for keeping the corresponding table filter in synch. Creates and installs appropriate input fields on the JYTableHeader used as subheader.

Properties to configure (names pending ... ):

  • incremental - controls whether the filter is updated on each key-typed or on enter/focusLost only. Defaults to true.
  • andFilters - controls the logic of the compound filter: AND if true, OR if false. Defaults to true.
  • includeHidden - controls whether or not hidden columns are used in the compound filter. Defaults to true.
Exposes API to clear all filters. Internally, this functionality is bound to an Action which is registered in the subHeader's ActionMap with the key CLEAR_FILTERS_ACTION_COMMAND. It' key binding defaults to "shift ESCAPE". It can be configured by setting a custom key description in the UIManager, with key "FilterRowController." + CLEAR_FILTERS_ACTION_COMMAND

Returns a boolean indicating whether the filters should be updated on key typed.

The default value is true.

Returns:
the incremental property
See Also:
setIncremental(boolean)

setIncremental

public void setIncremental(boolean incremental)
Sets the incremental property. If true, the filters are updated on key-typed, if false they are updated on hitting enter or focus lost.

The default value is true.

Parameters:
incremental - a boolean indicating whether the filter should be updated on key-typed.
See Also:
isIncremental()

setAndFilters

public void setAndFilters(boolean andFilters)
Sets a flag to control the compound logic. If true, the per-column filters are chained by AND, if false by OR.

The default value is true.

Parameters:
andFilters - the andFilters to set

isAndFilters

public boolean isAndFilters()
Returns the flag which controls the compound logic.

Returns:
the andFilters
See Also:
setAndFilters(boolean)

setIncludeHidden

public void setIncludeHidden(boolean includeHidden)
Sets a flag to control which columns to include into the compound filter. If true, both visible and hidden columns are included, if false only visible columns are included.

The default value is true.

Parameters:
includeHidden - the includeHidden to set

isIncludeHidden

public boolean isIncludeHidden()
Returns the flag to control which columns to include into the compound filter.

Returns:
the includeHidden
See Also:
setIncludeHidden(boolean)

setDefaultColumnFilterFactory

public void setDefaultColumnFilterFactory(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                          IColumnFilterFactory<? extends javax.swing.table.TableModel> factory)
Sets the default factory for columnFilters to use with the specified class.

Note: this method does not recreate existing filters with the potentially new factory type. The recommended work-flow is to first customize the table and then set the model. Per-column factories are updated on changing the column's factory property.

Parameters:
clazz - the Class for with the factory is used, must not be null
factory - the factory to use, may be null to remove a previously registered per-class factory.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if clazz is null

createDefaultFilterFactory

protected IColumnFilterFactory<javax.swing.table.TableModel> createDefaultFilterFactory()
Returns the base default ColumnFilterFactory, guaranteed to be not null.

This implementation returns a factory of Type PatternColumnFilterFactory.

Returns:
the default ColumnFilterFactory

getDefaultColumnFilterFactory

public IColumnFilterFactory<? extends javax.swing.table.TableModel> getDefaultColumnFilterFactory(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
Returns the ColumnFilterFactory to be used when no factory has been set in a JYTableColumnExt. During the creation of columnFilters the factory is fetched from a Map of entries according to the class of the cells in the column. If there is no entry for this clazz the method returns the entry for the most specific superclass. The FilterRowController installs entries for Object, Number, Date, and Boolean.

Parameters:
clazz - the clazz to lookup the default ColumnFilterFactory
Returns:
the most appropriate ColumnFilterFactory for the given clazz, or the one registered for Object if none found or the clazz is null.
See Also:
setDefaultColumnFilterFactory(Class, IColumnFilterFactory)
